results.title: Henri Rousseau: le douanier (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lo Duca, F Tavano and Ecrans Modernes
results.brief_description: Portrays the life of the French primitive painter, Henri Rousseau, as reflected in his paintings. The film discusses the “phenomenon of Rousseau” in the evolution of the art of painting, shows the life of his imagination and reviews his work according to its inner logic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lo Duca, F Tavano and Ecrans Modernes

results.title: Henley and Wimbledon 1961
results.brief_description: Angela Mortimer became the first British woman to win Wimbledon since 1937 when she defeated Chritine Truman in 1961. Shows highlights from this match and the 1961 Henley Regatta.

results.title: Helping you to help your child
results.creator_credit: Bill Cole and New Zealand Council for Educational Research
results.brief_description: Contains four sequences intended to introduce parents to the essential features to be observed in tutoring their children. The advice given is directed towards parents with older children having reading difficulties. The procedures suggested are not intended as a basis for tutoring younger children learning to read in a regular school program.

results.title: Helping learners to learn
results.creator_credit: Nestor Lovera, Francis Gysin and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: A modern conception of training as a process of attaining objectives. The use of “feedback” from tests enables instructors to modify their courses and to adapt their methods to reach the objectives set. Training is presented as a precisely designed instrument for attaining precisely defined ends. Intended for instructors in the coal industry.

results.title: Help yourself to a better back
results.brief_description: This tape offers a brief but fairly comprehensive introduction to safe workplace practice and back care in both office and industrial settings. For office workers the main cause of back injury is sitting for long periods, without breaks and without varying the pose of the body. This video suggests a series of simple exercises that take just a couple of minutes, and can be performed at the desk or in a restricted area. For workers in industry the main risk is lifting. The video provides a simple and easy to follow checklist of things to remember when lifting. It also provides details of good lifting and carrying techniques.

results.title: Reality therapy and discipline at home
results.creator_credit: Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Help for parents”.
Designed to provide ideas for developing parenting skills to help young people evaluate their behaviour and to plan more acceptable alternatives. Dr William Glasser interviews Tom McGuiness presenting the basic practices used in the Parent Involvement Program at the Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre in Los Angeles. Demonstrates how each step is applied in the parent-child relationship.

group_works.title: Reality therapy and discipline at home
group_works.creator_credit: Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre

results.title: Ten step discipline program
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help for parents”
Ten step discipline program: Steps 1 to 3 helps teachers use Reality Therapy on themselves. Steps 4 to 6 provide teachers with a simple but effective approach. Steps 7 to 10 consider what procedures can be followed if students refuse to change their behaviour.

results.title: Helicopter management: fire
results.brief_description: The helicopter is widely used in all phases of forest fire control in America. This training film is designed to assist personnel in planning, organising and directing helicopter operations safely and efficiently.
